title: What are the risks of hypnotism experiments without proper knowledge and how can they be avoided?
first_phrase: This text, a stenographic report of experiments conducted by Donato on experimental fascination, was presented on December 15, 1880, at the Lausanne Society of Medicine. It includes a caution about the dangers facing subjects who are not properly revived after being subjected to hypnosis. The author emphasizes that these risks can be prevented by properly understanding the physiological and anatomical causes of muteness, and describes his extensive experience with a variety of phenomena produced through magnetism.
